result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashla R. Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DEFENDANT HAS 11 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF REVOKED

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashla R. Schultz

Defendant Ashla R. Schultz in court.  Attorney Gene A Cisewski in court for Ashla R. Schultz.  Attorney Crystal N Long in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty and is found guilty of count 1. 2 yrs probation with conditions. 11 days sentence credit if revoked.
